newsitem.title: INDIA: Daewoo says leads India mid-size cars.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo says leads India mid-size cars.

text.p: Daewoo Motors (India Ltd), formerly DCM Daewoo, said on Thursday that it sold 1,291 cars of its Cielo model in April, out of a total sales of 5,208 cars in the mid-size segment of the car market.
"With this Cielo has overtaken all other cars in the mid-size car segment and leads the market in sales volume," it said in a statement.
Daewoo Motors (India), 91.63 percent owned by South Korea's Daewoo Corp, sold 17,000 of the midsize 1,000cc Cielo model in India during 1996/97.
Daewoo has an annual capacity to produce 72,000 finished cars and 300,000 engines, gearboxes and other components.
It expects to produce 32,000 cars including its new models in 1997/98.
